instruction: How were the classification models built in the related study on cotton verticillium wilt identification based on spectral and image feature fusion, and what were the specific machine learning algorithms used?
Output:
In the related study on cotton verticillium wilt identification based on spectral and image feature fusion, the classification models were built using two machine learning algorithms: support vector machine (SVM) and back propagation neural network (BPNN).

For the spectral feature processing, the preprocessing methods used were Savitzky-Golay smoothing (SG), multiplicative scatter correction (MSC), de-trending (DT), and mean normalization (MN) algorithms. The feature band extraction methods used were principal component analysis (PCA) and successive projections algorithm (SPA).

For the RGB image feature processing, the EfficientNet model was applied to build the classification model. From the last convolutional layer of the EfficientNet model, 16 image features were extracted.

The obtained spectral and image features were then fused, and the classification models were established using SVM and BPNN algorithms.

Overall, the specific machine learning algorithms used in this study were SVM and BPNN for building the classification models based on the fused spectral and image features.

instruction: How does the use of fused spectral and image features based on hyper-spectral imaging compare to traditional methods in terms of accuracy for identifying cotton verticillium wilt?
